Senior Analytics Engineer

Seattle, Washington United States, United States

Full Time Senior-level / Expert USD 168K - 210K
  • Website
  • @remitly ùïè

  • Search

Remitly

Transfer EUR from Germany worldwide with confidence. You can rest easy knowing your money will be sent securely and on time, or we‚Äôll refund your fees.

View all jobs at Remitly

Apply now Apply later

Posted 4 weeks ago

Job Description:

Remitly is on a mission to transform the lives of immigrants and their families by providing the most trusted financial products and services on the planet. Since 2011, we have been tirelessly delivering on our promises to immigrants sending their hard earned money home. Today, we are reimagining international payments at scale and building new products to create deeper relationships with our customers and their loved ones across the globe. Join over 2,700 employees across 10 offices who are growing their careers while having a positive impact on people globally.

About the Role:

Under the supervision of the Analytics Engineering Manager, the Senior Analytics Engineer will lead a data mart strategy and use technical skills to build it out. Telecommuting is available from anywhere in the United States based on manager approval.

You Will:

  • Partner with analysts, engineers, product managers, and others to define the requirements while being accountable for delivering the end product.¬†

  • Lead the development of data marts and pipelines for several domains across the company.¬†

  • Collect business requirements, define successful analytics outcomes, and design data models.¬†

  • Set company-wide standards for data marts regarding structure, quality and expectations.¬†

  • Help maintain the data catalog.¬†

  • Mentor less experienced engineers.

You Have:

  • Position requires a Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Analytics, Project Management, or a related field, and 2 years of experience with analytics engineering.

  • 2 years of experience with dimensional data modeling.¬†

  • 2 years of experience with ETL design, implementation, and maintenance.¬†

  • 2 years of experience with query optimization and improving pipeline performance by reducing time or complexity.¬†

  • 2 years of experience working with cross-functional teams, engineers, and product managers to define and manage roadmaps and KPIs.¬†

  • 2 years of experience working with reporting dashboards and Business Review Scorecards.¬†

  • 2 years of experience with AWS Glue, CI/CD, DataOps best practices, GIT, Pandas, Python, QuickSight, Redshift, SQL, and Tableau.

Our Benefits

  • Flexible paid time off

  • Health, dental, and vision benefits + 401k plan with company matching

  • Company contributions to your HSA plan, if you choose one

  • Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) available for eligible employees

  • Continuing education and corridor travel benefits

Compensation Details. The starting base salary range for this position is typically $168,000.00 ‚Äì $210,000.00 in the U.S., Remitly employees are shareholders in our Company and equity is part of our total compensation plan. Your recruiter can share more information about medical benefits offered, as well as other financial benefits and total compensation components offered with this role.

Your recruiter can share more information about medical benefits offered, as well as other financial benefits and total compensation components offered with this role.

Remitly is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Equal employment opportunity has been, and will continue to be, a fundamental principle at Remitly. We are committed to nondiscrimination across our global organization and in all of our business operations. Employment is determined based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without discrimination on the basis of race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender identification and expression, marital status, military status or status as an honorably discharge/veteran, pregnancy (including a woman's potential to get pregnant, pregnancy-related conditions, and childbearing), sexual orientation, age (40 and over), national origin, ancestry, citizenship or immigration status, physical, mental, or sensory disability (including the use of a trained dog guide or service animal), HIV/AIDS or hepatitis C status, genetic information, status as an actual or perceived victim of domestic violence, sexual assault, or stalking, or any other protected class as established by law.
